abstracts.cdata!:
The Power and Communications Sectors
            Modernization and Rural Services Project aims at deepening
            reforms in the telecommunications, and electricity sectors,
            by strengthening regulatory institutions, and improving
            environmental management of the sectors' activities,
            fostering competition, and increasing private participation,
            promoting efficient use of energy, and providing new
            information and communication technologies (IT) to support
            services to micro, and small businesses. The components
            will: 1) strengthen the legal and regulatory frameworks in
            telecommunications, and electricity. Public consultations,
            and dissemination of regulatory decisions will be undertaken
            to supervise, and strengthen the Telecommunications Agency
            (SUPTEL), while software programs, and equipment will be
            financed, and a telecommunications tariff rebalancing plan
            prepared. Electricity regulations of the National Council of
            Electricity will be completed, including strengthening its
            institutional capacity, and monitoring criteria, and that of
            other sector institutions. Selected energy, and tariff
            studies will support these activities; 2) extend services to
            low income groups, and small businesses in peri-urban areas,
            by developing pilot projects, an electrification strategy
            (both grid-extension and off-grid), revising IT regulations,
            and, developing IT access in marginal urban, and rural
            areas; 3) design, and implement a program to promote the
            use, and conservation of electricity, to include tariff
            incentives, standards for efficient electrical appliances,
            public information, and, market assessment, and training to
            local energy service companies; and, 4) finance project
            management, consultation, and communications activities to
            provide support to implementing agencies, and the private sector.
